g.H3847: properly, wrap around, i.e. (by implication) to put on agarment or clothe (oneself, or another), literally or figuratively
g.H854: properly, nearness (used only as a preposition or an adverb), near; hence, generally, with, by, at, among, etc.

g.H499: Elazar, the name of seven Israelites
g.H4191: to die (literally or figuratively); causatively, to kill
g.H8033: there (transferring to time) then; often thither, or thence
g.H7218: the head (as most easily shaken), whether literal or figurative (in many applications, of place, time, rank, itc.)
g.H2022: a mountain or range of hills (sometimes used figuratively)

g.H4480: properly, a part of; hence (prepositionally), from or out of in many senses

g.H3605: properly, the whole; hence, all, any or every (in the singular only, but often in a plural sense)
g.H5712: a stated assemblage (specifically, a concourse, or generally, a family or crowd)
g.H7200: to see, literally or figuratively (in numerous applications, direct and implied, transitive, intransitive and causative)
g.H3588: (by implication) very widely used as a relative conjunction or adverb (as below); often largely modified by other particles annexed
g.H1478: to breathe out, i.e. (by implication) expire
g.H1004: a house (in the greatest variation of applications, especially family, etc.)
g.H3478: Jisrael, a symbolical name of Jacob; also (typically) of his posterity
g.H853: properly, self (but generally used to point out more definitely the object of a verb or preposition, even or namely)
